channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Smoke and Air Quality Concerns from Boats on Lee River / end of Riverside Close Area, 10th October
item.description:
We’ve noticed that the heating season has started, and the air quality along the Lee River (at the end of Riverside Close) has become quite bad again. Some people on boats seem to be burning unpleasant materials in their stoves, producing thick, irritating

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Riverside Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees leaning and a threat to our property and outbuildings, 10th October
item.description:
Hi We were told years ago that a few trees not in our jurisdiction couldn't be cut down or trimmed to the core. Please can you analyse and have an officer come to the external part of our property. This is affecting our insurance and we cannot lie. I look forward to hearing from you soon. Kind regards Mr. Nandra 5 Clive road Belvedere Kent DA175BJ
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lessness Park, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Fowling issues, 10th October
item.description:
Everyday there is dog Fowling issues all over Webber Row, Webber Street and Baron's place SE1. This has been going on for the past couple of years now and it's very distressful walking out on the pavement. I have had to result to walking in the roads but now the since past few months I have seen dog Fowling on the roads. There is so far no attempt from the council to clean this up. There needs to be be regular cleaning of this type of waste as you see it present for weeks/ months same spots.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webber Row, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1-8 Exeter Mansions, Exeter Road, NW2 3UG, 10th October
item.description:
This sofa has been in our front garden porch all day at least. We first saw it early this morning and we’ve been in and out of the building a few times and it’s still there. We’re unaware of where it came from, but we doubt someone living in the building would leave it in the garden and risk damaging it. It’s not the first time we have tents, blankets etc left in the porch by rough sleepers.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Exeter Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street have not been swept or cleaned in months, 10th October
item.description:
The pavement along Woolwich Road has not been cleaned for an extended period. As a result, there is a visible buildup of dirt, litter, and debris. In some areas, leaves and mud have accumulated, creating a slippery and unsightly surface. This is a continuous issue and regular cleaning is required. Please arrange weekly cleaning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
